comments.body: This is interesting - why'd this happen? Do we do this anywhere else with type baselines?

This happens because we now call `getTypeFromTypeNode` in `checkUnionOrIntersectionType`. We used to not do that, which means we wouldn't report errors on excessively large unions unless you referenced them somewhere. That was inconsistent.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +126,130 @@
type WIDTH_OR_HEIGHT = "width" | "height";
>WIDTH_OR_HEIGHT : WIDTH_OR_HEIGHT

type Q10 = Shape["name"];  // string
